data.title: Hendersonville Music Calendar — Puckett's Restaurant
data.meta_description: Puckett’s Restaurant is known for its live music at all of our locations. Check out our live music calendar, and join us for a show and a delicious meal.
data.text:
Joe & Diane- 8.3.24

The music of Joe and Diane is a refreshing reminder of the quality and richness of true, traditional country music! Joe and Diane have been singing and performing together as Nashville’s newest duet team!

Joe Wade Smith is originally from West Virginia and was raised in Maryland. His music background started when he was a teenager sitting around at family reunions and get-togethers picking and singing with his uncles and cousins. He won several singing competitions through the years in Maryland, with one landing him a spot on The Nashville Network’s “You Can Be A Star”. He moved to Tennessee in the beginning of 2013 and has a large fan base that includes people from all around the world.

Diane Berry was born into a musical family and grew up in a little town in Arkansas. She moved to Nashville in the early ‘80’s playing guitar singing in one of the shows in Opryland Park. That fall, Roy Acuff asked her to be his guest on the Grand Ole’ Opry and after that performance, Diane worked the Grand Ole’ Opry for twenty eight years with different artists such as: Jeannie Seely, Johnny Russell, Grandpa Jones, Jan Howard, Skeeter Davis, Jim Ed Brown, Charlie Louvin and Johnny Counterfit. Diane is also an accomplished songwriter. Connie Smith recorded the gospel song “Take My Hand” on her last album that Diane wrote to honor her mother.

Singing together just felt right….so, they started doing shows together as a duet and are seeing wonderful success. They have a new album of songs like, “Would You Love Me”, “We Never Had It Easy But We Always Had It Good”which got them nominated for Vocal Group of the Year for the 2021 Arkansas Country Music Awards and also for Traditional Country Music along with Music Event of the Year for the Josie Awards (an Independent Awards Show). The year of 2022 turned out to be a banner year for Joe and Diane. With the song, “Yours”, they won “Song of The Year” at the Arkansas Country Music Awards along with winning “Vocal Event of the Year” at the Josie Awards! Ladies and Gentleman…I present to you….JOE AND DIANE!

www.joeanddiane.com

Show at 8:00 pm, no cover, tips appreciated, BOOK ONLINE or call 865-285-0155 for dinner reservations.

We don’t want y’all to miss out on the music, so when booking your online reservation for a show, please be sure to select the correct date for the show you are wanting to attend. The default setting is to automatically select today’s date. Thanks for spending your evening with us!

The Road Crew- 8.10.24

The popular Nashville, TN-based rockabilly band, The Road Crew, is an entertaining attraction wherever they perform along Route 66. They have played festivals and car shows in Litchfield IL, Cuba, Springfield & Joplin MO, Galena KS, Afton and Clinton OK and Amarillo TX. This August they will play the International Rt. 66 Festival in Kingman AZ. They have even done a few unplugged, sometimes impromptu, tour of smaller venues that included stops at places like Afton Station in Afton, OK and The Rock Café in Stroud, OK. The group was recently honored with the inaugural “Bobby Troup Artistic Acheivement Award” by the International Route 66 Association in recognition of their album, Songs from the Mother Road.

The Road Crew’s album, Songs from the Mother Road, is really a group of stories about the struggles, the joys, the heartbreaks and the adventures associated with Route 66. The musical styles include folk, country, blues, western swing and even a touch of surfer pop. The 12 original song titles include We’re Going West, Chair Of Rocks Park, The Motherland OK, Tucumcari Tonite, Running Down The Mother Road, The Old Way (For Angel) and That Ol’ 66. In tribute to the late Bobby Troop, The Road Crew even adds their (Beatles inspired) flavor to his classic hit (Get Your Kicks On) Route 66 as a special bonus track.

The group introduced their second CD, Rock-A-Billy Road, an album comprised of mostly upbeat 1950s classic songs that served as a soundtrack for travelers breezing down the highway during the heyday of Route 66. The album includes the theme song for the International Route 66 Association Festival, The Road To Amarillo, composed by Joe and Don.

If you run into them along the road, just know that you are meeting four guys who love the road, love the people and love the places they sing about just as much as you do. You can learn more about The Road Crew on their website, http://roadcrew66.com.

Show at 8:00 pm, no cover, tips appreciated, BOOK ONLINE or call 865-285-0155 for dinner reservations.

We don’t want y’all to miss out on the music, so when booking your online reservation for a show, please be sure to select the correct date for the show you are wanting to attend. The default setting is to automatically select today’s date. Thanks for spending your evening with us!

David Isenberg Trio- 8.23.24

Although he was born in Virginia, David’s home town and heritage is Cottontown, Tennessee in Sumner Co. Growing up, the Nashville skyline was a regular commodity to David, as well as country music, but it wasn’t until later in life that he realized that he discovered his talent and passion for music artistry. According to family history, David’s grandmother Carol Johnson was a succefull singer who played on the Grand Old Opry and toured with Jim & Jesse. Also, David’s uncle-in-law is renound songwriter Sanger D. “Whitey” Shafer, who pinned such hits as All My Exes Live in Texas and much more. David was unaware of the significance of his musical bloodline when he decided to become an artist for himself. He felt like it was a call from God that he answered, and finding out about his uncle and grandmother just reinforced what he felt to be his calling in life.

David has now written over 200 songs and is well on his way to becoming a Nashville namesake. Some of his biggest musical influences include Bob Dylan, Johnny Cash, Hank Williams, George Jones, Alan Jackson, Billy Currington as well as modern art acts like, Jack White and the White Stripes,

Nirvana, Alice in Chains and the Gorillaz.

David started his professional musical journey at the world famous Tootsie’s Orchid Lounge. Since beginning in 2019, David has played 500+ shows for Tootsie’s on Broadway, mingled and performed with stars such as Jimmy Fallon, Joe Walsh, Billy Ray Cyrus, and Breaking Bad stars Aaron Paul and Bryan Cranston!

Currently, David is recording his debut breakout album with Nashville producer Ben Reno, in Franklin, TN. For the album, he will be joined by rock-and-roll hall of fame drummer, Steve Ferrone, who was the main drummer for Tom Petty and the Heart Breakers for over 30 years, and one of the most recorded drummers in history.

David also plays in full bands at The Mellow Mushroom in Nashville, TN and has a weekly Wednesday night slot at margaritaville.

Off the stage David is a hard working family man with a loving wife and 2 beautiful children.

Music is more than a hobby to David. It is a passion and a way of life. And sharing the love of that experience with the workers and guests of wherever his talents take him, he considers his biggest privilege in life.

Show at 8:00 pm, no cover, tips appreciated, BOOK ONLINE or call 865-285-0155 for dinner reservations.

We don’t want y’all to miss out on the music, so when booking your online reservation for a show, please be sure to select the correct date for the show you are wanting to attend. The default setting is to automatically select today’s date. Thanks for spending your evening with us!

Carolina Pine- 8.24.24

Prior to the formation of Carolina Pine, both members had notable acheivement in Country Music, including sharing stages with artists like Billy Ray Cyrus, Larry Gatlin, Jimmy Fortune, Blue Highway, Kidd Rock and many more.

Woody James, raised in Millington, Illinois, learned to sing at a young age from his mother teaching him gospel songs. Woody’s father also instilled in him a deep love and knowledge for all music, which brought him to Nashville, Tennessee at age 22. Shortly after, he met his now partner, Kennedy Scott, in front of the renowned Ryman Auditorium.

Similar to Woody, Clayton, North Carolina native Kennedy Scott, learned to sing at an early age thanks to her papa who introduced her to artists like Emmylou Harris, Allison Krauss, and The Everly Brothers. The musical tradition in her family extends to many other relatives; including her father who builds her guitars.

The duo first sang together for a YouTube video of “We Must Have Been Out Of Our Minds,” written by the great Melba Montgomery and sang with country icon George Jones. The video instantly got over 100,000 views. Woody and Kennedy knew right away they wanted to write and record music together. Since then, they have toured with Country Music Hall of Fame member Alan Jackson, received radio play, warmed up the crowd for people like Phil Vassar, Luke Combs, and many more, as well as received endorsements from “Fishman” and “Kyser”.

Show at 8:00 pm, no cover, tips appreciated, BOOK ONLINE or call 865-285-0155 for dinner reservations.

We don’t want y’all to miss out on the music, so when booking your online reservation for a show, please be sure to select the correct date for the show you are wanting to attend. The default setting is to automatically select today’s date. Thanks for spending your evening with us!

Austin Gray- 7.18.24

The music of Austin Gray has been described as “a sweet fusion of Country and Americana.”

Currently residing in Memphis, Austin began to develop his unique style on the guitar at the age of twelve when he was introduced to the man who would kindle his love for performing. Jody Payne had just retired from 36 years as the lead guitar player for Willie Nelson and became fascinated with the skinny youngster about whom he told others, “reminds me of me.”

Several years after Jody’s passing, another Nashville legend took an interest in the young artist. Songwriter Jimmy Yeary—with CMA and ACM Song of the Year Awards—began to mentor Austin regarding all aspects of his career. Currently, the two even do corporate events together—speaking, playing, and singing— demonstrating to business people the purpose and power of mentoring.

Austin has become known as one of a handful of artists to whom audiences listen intently. His songwriting—lyrics and music—combine the influences of Jason Isbell, Shakey Graves, Merle Haggard, Sturgill Simpson, and Jimmy Yeary. Mix in a bit of John Prine with some of his original material and you might just have a picture of Austin Gray.

austingraymusic.com

Show at 7:30 pm, no cover, tips appreciated, BOOK ONLINE or call 865-285-0155 for dinner reservations.

We don’t want y’all to miss out on the music, so when booking your online reservation for a show, please be sure to select the correct date for the show you are wanting to attend. The default setting is to automatically select today’s date. Thanks for spending your evening with us

Hit writers round with Frank Myers, Brett Jones & Jason Sever- 6.14.24

Frank Myers

Frank J Myers is from Dayton, Ohio. He moved to Nashville in 1981. Frank got his start in Nashville as band leader, road manager and lead guitarist for Eddy Raven in 1981 and worked with Eddy for 9 years. It was with Eddy that Frank started writing, playing and co producing sessions. They had 2 number ones, 5 number twos and 3 top tens. Songs such as I Got Mexico, Bayou Boys, You Should’ve Been Gone By Now, Sometimes A Lady and many others. It was in 1982 though, that Frank had his first single (a song he wrote by himself) with You and I for Eddie Rabbitt and Crystal Gayle which stayed number one: four weeks country, number two for six weeks AC and number 6 for four weeks Pop.

It was during his time with Eddy Raven that Frank met Gary Baker. They had their first number one together in 1993 with Once Upon A Lifetime by Alabama. Gary and Frank recorded one album for MCG/Curb Records as Baker & Myers and were 3 time nominees for Duo Of The Year at the ACM’s and CMA’s. Their greatest accomplishment as writers together came when John Michael Montgomery recorded I Swear which was number one for 4 weeks on the Country charts. The song was then recorded by All 4 One and went to number one on the pop charts and stayed there for 11 weeks. Since then, I Swear has won these awards:

American Songwriter Magazine

Pop, AC, R&B, Country and Overall Song of the year. Pop, R&B, Country and Overall Songwriters of the year.

1st Annual Country Radio Awards

Single and Song of the year

C.M.A. Awards

Single of the year Song of the year nomination

Grammy Awards

Country song of the year

Best R&B Vocal and Song of the year nomination

A.C.M. Awards

Single and Song of the year

N.S.A.I. Awards

Award for Country, Pop, and AC Song of the year

A.S.C.A.P. Awards

Country, Pop and R&B Song of the Year

Billboard Magazine Awards

#1 song of 1994

Jukebox Awards

1994 Song and Songwriters of the Year

International Song Of The Years Awards Canada, Germany, Great Britain, France, Sweden, Switzerland, Japan and China

Frank also co-wrote I’m Already There the 7-week number one smash by Lonestar,which was nominated for a Grammy and CMA Song and Single Of The Year. The song also went to number 2 on the AC chart. It was also named American Songwriter Magazine’s Country Song of the year and Frank was voted Country Songwriter of the year along with Gary Baker and Richie McDonald. His single My Front Porch Looking In by Lonestar is the first record in R&R history to go to #1 fall to number #2 for 6 weeks and go back to #1. #1 Tomorrow by Chris Young which was also nominated for ACM Single of the Year. Frank has had songs recorded by over 50 Country and Pop Artists. 12 #1's and 20 top 10's

Brett Jones

Brett Jones is an American singer, songwriter, and music publisher from Warm Springs, Georgia, United States, working in country music. He has had over one hundred songs recorded, including fourteen top ten hits and five number one hits such as Neal McCoy's "You Gotta Love That", Jason Aldean's "Crazy Town", and John Michael Montgomery's "Cover You in Kisses". Jones, as an artist, also released his own CD called Life’s Road [5] in 2009 and followed with Cowboy Sailor in July 2014.

Jason Sever

Born and raised in Texas, Jason Sever has always had a love of music. Living in Nashville for over 22 years now, that love has only grown. After moving in the fall of 2001, Jason immediately began singing demos for Nashville’s top writers, lending his vocals to several songs that climbed the charts. Jason is a vocalist that can sing like any artist out there, whatever it takes to grab their attention. Meeting the names behind most of his favorite songs, he fell into writing with them.

In 2009 he signed his first publishing deal with Little Champion Music, a company owned by John and Martina McBride. His first cut came that year. From the ten years after, many more followed. His first single as a writer came with the band The Lost Trailers in 2010. Titled, “UNDERDOG”, it reached #34 on the Top 40 as a completely independent release. Since then, Jason’s songs have been recorded by Luke Bryan, Tim McGraw, Jason Aldean, Martina McBride, Gary Allan, Dustin Lynch, Parmalee, Joe Nichols, Josh Kelley, and the metal band Seether.

He has also had several overseas cuts by European artists, including a single by Yannick Bovy on Warner Brothers Records titled, “Enduring Love”. Jason’s most recent success was with the Billboard and Mediabase #1, SEEIN RED, by Dustin Lynch. He’s currently spending a lot of his writing time working with Veterans and their families to share their stories through music. He continues to write and record and looks forward to the future and the songs yet to come.

Show at 8:00 pm, no cover, tips appreciated, BOOK ONLINE or call 865-285-0155 for dinner reservations.

We don’t want y’all to miss out on the music, so when booking your online reservation for a show, please be sure to select the correct date for the show you are wanting to attend. The default setting is to automatically select today’s date. Thanks for spending your evening with us!

Hit Writers Round with Jay Gavin, Hawkshaw Hawkins Jr. & Billy Don Burns- 5.31.24

Jay Gavin

Jay Gavin grew up in a tiny close-knit Canadian fishing village on Prince Edward Island where the potato fields are lined by red dirt roads, there isn’t a stop light for 100 miles and the kitchen parties go on for days. After years touring North America and recording as a bassist with punk & metal bands like Spawner Record’s Huskavarna, and Texas thrash legends Speedealer, Jay came full circle and returned to his roots in country.

Jay writes and sings songs for fans of real county music and is often compared to artists like Jerry Jeff Walker, Robert Earl Keen and John Prine. Jay's on tour in 2024 promoting his latest album Road Ready produced by five time Grammy nominee Denny Knight (Waylon Jennings, Conway Twitty) of the Nashville Music Group. Reaching #3 on the Alt-Country Specialty Charts with Road Ready, Jay has radio and PR support for his tour.

Whether backed by a full band or stripped down with just his guitar, his live show feels like a party. You'll laugh and sing and dance and go home feeling that you've made a new friend. Jay can't wait to share a song and a beer with his fans across North America this year!

www.jaygavinmusic.com

Hawkshaw Hawkins

Hawk was born April 8, 1963 to Country Music Hall of Fame star Ms. Jean Shepard. Hawk Jr was the second born son of legendary Hawkshaw Hawkins who had the number one hit song in the country “Lonesome 77203” and untimely passed away the same week, just a month before Hawk was born. Hawkshaw died in the fatal crash that killed Patsy Cline and Cowboy Copas.

Born to two very musical people, naturally Hawk found himself following in their footsteps at a young age. Hawk learned to play guitar, and found he not only had a talent for playing, but his rich smooth voice was original and drew a crowd wherever he went. Hawk Jr has appeared on the stage of the Grand Ole Opry both the old Ryman auditorium and the new Opry at Opry Mills, he has done shows with such greats as Bill Anderson, Jack Green, Roy Clark, Charlie Louvin, The Marshall Tucker Band and much more.

Hawk Jr also has also the writer of over 500 songs and has had cuts from artist such as Johnny Lee, Ronnie Mcdowell, Hank Williams Jr, Davis Daniel, Shawn Camp, Ron Williams, and several other acts.

Hawk resides in Hendersonville TN.

cnicole1474.wixsite.com/hawk2

Billy Don Burns

Billy Don Burns is the real deal. He’s a no nonsense kind of guy who prefers to let his songs speak for themselves. After all, he’s been making music for more than fifty years and in that time, he’s seen both the ups and downs of the music business and has honestly expressed himself in a decidedly uncompromising way.

It’s little wonder then that his songs have been recorded by the best in the business - a list that includes Willie Nelson, Johnny Paycheck, Tanya Tucker, Mel Tillis, and Sammy Kershaw, to name but a few. And now a new generation has come along and recorded his songs – artists like Cody Jinks, Colter Wall, Whitey Morgan and others.

“I make music because that’s all I’ve ever done,” Billy Don maintains. “It’s all I know. I write because the songs come out of me and I’m privileged to be able to give them life.

Billy Don’s new album, I’ve Seen A Lot of Highway, released on October 6 via Shooter Jennings’ Black Country Rock label, provides an apt summation of both the struggles and successes he’s seen over the course of his career. BDB and his guitar landed in Nashville in 1972. Within a few weeks Harlan Howard had signed him as a writer with Wilderness Music, where he met Lefty Frizzell, Tanya Tucker, Waylon and Tommy Jennings. He was accepted in that crowd with Billy Joe Shaver, Lee Clayton, Billy Ray Reynolds, Steve Young, etc. He scored his first major cut by Connie Smith on Columbia Records in 1974. Over the years Burns became recognized as one of the original outlaws and great writers of country music. His songs pretty much tell his life story.

www.billydonburns.net/brothersofthemusic

Show at 8:00 pm, no cover, tips appreciated, BOOK ONLINE or call 865-285-0155 for dinner reservations.

We don’t want y’all to miss out on the music, so when booking your online reservation for a show, please be sure to select the correct date for the show you are wanting to attend. The default setting is to automatically select today’s date. Thanks for spending your evening with us!
